bibl.title: The Lithuanian Women Sisters' Mutual Beneficiary St. Veronica Society, West Pullman, Ill.
(Data Supplied by Alex Ambrose of F. L. P.)

notesStmt.note: Transcribed from digital images contributed to the Internet Archive by the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

sourceDesc.bibl: Chicago Foreign Language Press Survey, 1936-1941, Works Projects Administration, Chicago Public Library Omnibus Project

revisionDesc.change: Initial TEI transcription from PanGeo Partners, Inc.

bibl.title: THE LITHUANIAN WOMEN SISTERS' MUTUAL BENEFICIARY ST. VERONICA SOCIETY, WEST PULLMAN, ILL.
(Data Supplied by Alex Ambrose of F. L. P.)

body.p: The above mentioned society was organized March 15, 1914.

Extract from the constitution: "A person who has a husband not of the Roman-Catholic faith cannot be accepted in this society, or if being a member of this society would marry a man not of the Roman-Catholic faith she will be expelled from this society."
Every member who reads and keeps infidel literature against the Roman-Catholic religion, condemning the saints of God, all the holiness and the priests, will be expelled from the society.

The meetings are opened and closed with prayer. The members are accepted from
18 to 40 years of age. The membership dues are 25 cents per month, the sick benefit $5 per week. In case of death the members' benefit is $50, and the members pay one dollar each. The membership is about 80. The assets about $3,300.
The meetings are held at the church hall, 12225 Emerald Avenue.
President, Mrs. V. Tela, 12220 S. Union Avenue
